thread.title: Delicate baby hippo takes her first wobbly steps
thread.title_full: Delicate baby hippo takes her first wobbly steps

author: Christine Wang
title: Delicate baby hippo takes her first wobbly steps
text:
While most of America was prepping for football, one little baby hippo was experiencing a life milestone.
SEE ALSO: Aquarium animals star in the cutest Super Bowl hype video
We first met Fiona, a baby hippo born at the Cincinnati Zoo, at the end of January. We were blessed with a video of her taking a dip in a little pool .
Because Fiona was born six weeks premature, caretakers have been constantly monitoring her health and vitals. On Sunday, they happily reported that Fiona was strong enough to take her first steps and also shared a video of the event.
Encouraging news from hippo headquarters! This video, taken by animal care staff overnight, shows Fiona's 1st steps! https://t.co/RywHq2zIcl pic.twitter.com/9gcr4LHgru
â€” Cincinnati Zoo (@CincinnatiZoo) February 5, 2017
First steps are really tough, as your past baby-self can tell you. But even though she is wobbling, Fiona clearly nailed her first time moving on her own four feet.
Get it, baby girl! We're so proud of you.
Fiona had another good night and drank more from her bottle this afternoon than she has to date. She is now able to suckle both in and out of the water and is gaining weight. As of this morning, she was up to almost 37 pounds! Go #TeamFiona! #hippo #closeenoughtocare #cincinnatizoo #cincinnati
A photo posted by Cincinnati Zoo (@cincinnatizoo) on Feb 6, 2017 at 12:01pm PST
BONUS: Snow won't stop the animals in Oregon Zoo from having fun
